storyInfo: The string of events has left different scars on each participant, but Ebenholz has yet to find the strength to understand these scars. He still needs time.

attributes.content: Is that all there is?
I'm not hiding even a shred of truth from you.
attributes.name: Calm Nobleman

attributes.content: The way this was handled... was quite the surprise.
How should we proceed now?
attributes.name: Calm Nobleman

attributes.content: How should we proceed? We don't.
This never had anything to do with you to begin with. All we're doing now is making adjustments to how the territory in question will be handled. How does that have anything to do with you?
You're right about that, but with how things turned out, those Infected will get to stay on that city plate. It'll be difficult to keep them from gossiping about this.
attributes.name: Calm Nobleman

attributes.content: And? Who would believe Infected nonsense?
Then what shall we do next...?
attributes.name: Calm Nobleman

attributes.content: What shall we do next?
There's no rush. We still have lots to do.
That's all I have to report for this incident.
attributes.name: Respectful Servant

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: Have you located the piece that this Czerny man wrote during the incident?
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: The Empresses' Voice is ready to transcribe it at any moment and can personally play it for you in a few hours.
attributes.name: Respectful Servant

attributes.content: No need. I can listen to the recording.
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: Not bad. I can even hear him crying from the bottom of his heart as he wrote the piece.
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: He's a talented man. Too bad he's not quite talented enough.
attributes.name: Woman

attributes.content: So how did it go?
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Not bad. It didn't get worse.
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: Andante said the infection deterioration caused by the incident was unusual. Most infections went into a continuous, stable phase, and I'm no exception.
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: It's not going to get worse again like before, right?
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Andante said they looked into the phenomenon pretty thoroughly. Apparently nearly all of the Originium that got activated during the incident has gone into an extended low-activity state.
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: In other words, I get to hang around a little longer.
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: Thank goodness...
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Right, does Andante know what the Herzog is going to do with the Afterglow?
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Well, this is just what she said she heard, but apparently the Empresses' Voice has requested the Herzog not lay a finger on the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: Oh, thank heavens, and thank Their Majesties' kindness—
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Keep it down!
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: *Sigh*, what should we do from here on out...?
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Oh, shut up. You don't think things have gotten out of hand enough as is?
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: What to do from here on out? Live one day at a time, that's what.
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: I want to live more than a day, though.
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Then you should really keep your mouth shut.
attributes.name: Dispirited Infected

attributes.content: Hibiscus, I finally get it now. There are some things that you're better off not knowing anything about.
attributes.name: Andante

attributes.content: I guess I'll apply to be transferred somewhere else as soon as I'm done with the follow-up work here.
attributes.name: Andante

attributes.content: Maybe I'll go to the landship. That sounds nice.
attributes.name: Andante

attributes.content: Don't move.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: It took a lot of effort just to find you.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Do you have anything to say?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: It was your men who tricked Kreide into coming to Vyseheim, right?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Everything you said was the truth, except for the bit about payment. You knew he was in a hurry to make money for my treatment, and you lured him into this mess with that.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: But you two had nothing against each other! Why did you do it?!
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: If I told you, I'd have to kill you.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I don't have much longer to live to begin with.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Alright then. Seeing as we're old colleagues, I will tell you.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Gräfin Strollo was already looking for Kreide, and she was very close to finding him.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: So what? Kreide was always there by my side, and that practically meant you had full control of him!
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: You read her research notes. You know full well just how terrifying her work on the Voice of Mundane was.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Until I got my hands on her notes, all I knew was that she had put a lot of time into researching this subject, but I never knew the true extent of her research.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: If we'd let her continue working, she might just have been able to do something even more appalling with the Voice of Mundane. Say, triggering and inducing Resonanz at much greater ranges.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You could've woken up in the morning and found your grandson transformed into a monster. Would you have wanted that?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Rather than letting things come to that, it was much better to bring Kreide right to her. Put the rush on her, and let her put her plan in motion before she could work out the kinks.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: So? Any more questions?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: What would you have done if Ebenholz hadn't found the amplifiers in the Afterglow Hall?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: However the Afterglow turned out, that's how I would've turned out myself.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: No further questions.
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: Come with me, then.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Not going to kill me?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: I've got no reason to kill you, and it would've given me yet another thing to weigh on my conscience.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Come. Let's head to my shop for a cup of coffee. We'll talk about those stupid, honorable young men.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Must I?
attributes.name: Grandpa

attributes.content: What do you think?
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Lava?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Why'd you push yourself like that? If anything happened to you, I'd never, ever forgive you!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Oh, you're talking about what happened in Vyseheim, right? Look, I'm all fine—
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: And who was it who had a standoff with an angry mob, who didn't evacuate even knowing that she'd be affected by the Voice of Mundane, and who fought those people even though she barely learned any Arts?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I don't remember telling you any of this...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I already talked to Mr. Czerny! He told me everything!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Uh... If you wanted to know all the whys and wherefores, why didn't you come talk to me directly?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I actually visited Mr. Czerny to ask him about my piano teacher in Leithanien, Mr. Johann, and it was only after we kept talking that I found out you almost—
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Almost...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: —I'm warning you! If something like this happens again, don't you dare push yourself like that! Y-You hear me?! You hear me?!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Alright, don't cry anymore. Look, see? I'm alright.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But your infection—!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Yes, it's got rather severe thanks to the Voice of Mundane, but it's under control now, so...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No! That's not enough! You're always on my case about my health, but you don't care about what happens to you at all!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: If you... If I lost you... I... I...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Lava, I promise you I'll look out for myself more, okay?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Really.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Don't you dare lie to me!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Why would I? The Doctor gave me quite a long holiday, you know? I'm going to spend this time well and get some quality rest in.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Alright, now, you said you asked him about Mr. Johann? How is he?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Mr. Czerny said he saw Mr. Johann at a gathering a year ago and that he was fine and well.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Speaking of, you went all the way to Leithanien yourself and even got a flute for your wand. Did you learn how to play while you were there?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: You mean this?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: The most I'm doing with it is treating it as a wand. I don't know how to play.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Really?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Of course really.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You're just being shy, aren't you?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Why would I be shy about this?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I don't believe you! Play something!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Well... Alright, here goes...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Alright!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: That's the worst sound I've ever heard in my life!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Thanks for your concern, Doctor. I'm feeling very well.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: And I must thank you again for the protection you are offering the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If you and Rhodes Island hadn't intervened, the Empresses' Voice would never have lifted a finger for my home.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.options: Just doing my job.;Helping the Infected is Rhodes Island's creed.;The Afterglow is a lot easier to handle than Ebenholz.

attributes.content: You're too humble.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: It's exactly as you said, and I'm starting to appreciate that more and more.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I suppose there must be a reason you summoned me here?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.options: You asked to be deployed to the front lines, and I have to confirm your intentions.

attributes.content: I've already written my thoughts in full on the report.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.options: Your condition's stable, but your infection's serious.

attributes.content: I'm prepared.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Truth be told, Doctor. When Hibiscus helped me up and walked me to the concert hall, I was already prepared to die.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Even though so much has happened, and things turned out nothing like I had imagined, I... lived.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: It really feels quite peculiar, and I cannot describe it very well, whether through words or music.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I'm not expecting to find how to express this feeling on the battlefield, but I'm thinking that it might prove beneficial if I try to fight for the Infected in an entirely different way.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.options: But do wait for your evaluation results.

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Speaking of which, Ebenholz is here too, is he?
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: I haven't seen him at all since the day after we arrived at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Sometimes, I can't help but think that the black-clad Graf Urtica might have actually died.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.options: According to Leithanien's official reports, he's indeed gone.;He's alive and well. Give him some time.;Ironically, that actually helped get our cooperation with Leithanien on track.

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Well then, I'll take my leave now, Doctor.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.options: Speaking of Ebenholz, it happens the next thing on my agenda has to do with him.
Do you want to see him?

attributes.content: Never mind. I don't dare to claim I know how much this incident has affected him. I can only imagine.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: If there comes a day when he's willing to see me or Hibiscus, we'll talk then.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.content: Goodbye, Doctor.
attributes.name: Czerny

attributes.options: Goodbye.;......;I look forward to hearing the music you'll write off the battlefield, and hope it'll be no less impressive than your past work.

attributes.content: Doctor? I'm surprised you found me here.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.options: Some nice, fresh air with all the wind here. Helps destress.;......;There's an Operator who saw you here.

attributes.content: I don't need destressing.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Have you got nothing to say to me?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Who? I don't mind having a little chat.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.options: I digress. I'm a Messenger today. Here's a letter for you.

attributes.content: A letter? Where is it from?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I have an idea what it is. Hand it over.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.options: Need me to stay and open it with you? One of my many services.

attributes.content: You're a funny one.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I really can't imagine you in a fight... Are you always this lighthearted when you're out commanding battles?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.options: Haha.;......;I wouldn't mind you getting a little less serious when you're off to a field operation.

attributes.content: Is this how you always react when you're embarrassed?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You have that hood on, and you hardly ever say a word. Hmm hmm. It's quite imposing.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Well, I look forward to it, then.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.options: I'm going then. Enjoy your alone time.

attributes.content: That goes without saying.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This... is the passport of a Leithanian citizen... Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Kreide's... and Graf Urtica's... death certiﬁcates.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hm? There's more?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: A letter?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.text: Congratulations on the freedom that you have been longing for.
I am writing this letter to inform you that our common enemy, Graf Urtica, has passed away.
I would like to extent my sincerest apologies to you in regard to the troubles he and his friends have brought about.
It is my hope that this letter and the file enclosed may reach you as a consolation.
P.S. Please ensure that the death of Graf Urtica remains a cold hard fact.
Otherwise our joint effort will eventually go down the drain.

attributes.content: It's not signed... An anonymous letter?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Just my impression of her.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Operator Ebenholz presses the tip of his wand to the letter and sets it ablaze.
Not long after, the flames reach the passport, then the Count of Urtica's death certificate, and then Kreide's.
The smell of burning paper spreads across the deck.
Ebenholz picks up the cello next to him.
He thinks back to how his dear friend played the cello, closes his eyes, and begins to play a simple, lively melody.
When the Twin Empresses first took control, countless pieces of music singing their praises sprung up all over Leithanien. This, too, is one of those pieces.

Today, the second half of the song has long been forgotten. Only the first half is still sung by a small number of people, thanks to its uplifting melody and the lyrics openly express the singer's cheerful mood.
The sunset is glaringly bright.
